points.notes: framework, no-framework, whatever; trust the team

points.point: wrap it up - keep it in the box
points.notes: separate concerns and if you use other code - wrap it; don't fake third party apis; deferring decisions; let application drive design

points.point: wrap up accessories - keep them boxed up too
points.notes: callbacks and passed objects; easier tests; cleaner/clearer tests
you ain't gonna need it; unfortunate acronym same as you are gonna need it; you're writing an application, not a framework; if used to frameworks there is a tendency to generalise - resist
no framework, but still expect there to be separate lower level code
open up greater possibility of exploding newness; esp. new language; packaging libraries can still be significant work

points.point: put aside time to talk about the codebase
put aside time to revisit decisions and design
for larger feature re-use: use applications
team must be ready and mature
points.notes: responsibility, leadership, but raises big questions if your team not ready - setting low bar
